events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on a busy street resulting in significant damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after confirming the involvement of a personal car and verifying the incident description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the claimant with the next steps, including document submission and assessment.
The claim has been officially acknowledged by the insurance company, and a claim reference number was provided to the customer.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report copy, and repair estimates to proceed with investigation.
Customer successfully submitted all required documents including clear photos, official police report, and a detailed repair quotation.
The investigation team began reviewing the documents and contacted the repair shop to verify the damage and estimate accuracy.
Investigation completed with a conclusion supporting the claim and verifying the extent of damages aligned with the customer's report.
The insurance provider proposed a settlement amount covering full repairs and additional rental car compensation for downtime.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and praised the prompt handling of the accident claim process.
The insurance claim was officially approved after receiving customer concurrence on the proposed settlement terms.
The approved payment was issued directly to the repair facility to ensure quick commencement of vehicle repairs.
The claim was closed successfully after repair completion confirmation and receipt of customer final approval.
